article.headline: UAB 82, South Alabama 76
article.story: MOBILE, Ala. (AP) -- Marvett McDonald scored 21 points and had six rebounds, leading UAB to a 82-76 victory over South Alabama on Friday night. McDonald made 5-of-12 from the field, including four from 3-point range plus 7-of-8 free throws for the Blazers (9-3). Ronell Taylor scored 14 points, Demario Eddins had 12 and Donell Taylor 11. Jeffrey Collins hit 5-of-7 free throws to score 17 points for the Jaguars (3-8). Mario Jointer made four 3s also for 17 points. Brandon Gordon scored 11 points, while Daniel Northern and Carlos Smith each added 10 points. McDonald closed the first half on a 10-0 spurt, powered by two 3-pointers, to tie the game 40-40 at halftime. UAB took its first lead of the game, 54-52, with 12:11 left to play on an Ernest Little dunk. The teams exchanged baskets until Jointer tied the game again with a pair of free throws at the 4:48 mark, making it 67-67. UAB sealed the victory closed the game on a 15-9 surge.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
